Dear Ms. Banks:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on February
16, 2022. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and
Modified Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a written corrective action plan is
required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12212 Personnel records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the following
information before employment may occur:
(h) Documentation from the department that the person
has not been named in a central registry case as the
perpetrator of child abuse or neglect in Michigan or in any
state where the person lived in the 5 years preceding hire.
One of three employee files reviewed did not contain verification that Central Registry
clearance was completed as required.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in
the agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(c) Conduct a thorough investigation including all
necessary collateral contacts
One of three special investigation files reviewed did not contain documentation that a
thorough investigation was completed. The report contained documentation of
interviews completed with foster parents and foster youth, however there was no
documentation that the foster parents and foster youth were asked anything related to
the allegations. The special investigation did not contain any collateral contacts
regarding the allegations.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:
4

SRM 200 Fingerprints
Personnel Training
SAT is required to be taken within six months of working in a
position with CW-CHRI access and every two years
thereafter. CPAs are responsible for ensuring that all
personnel with CHRI access completes SAT timely.
Based on review of the SRM 200 spreadsheet, one of four current employee who
have access to CHRI was found to be in non-compliance to timely certification of
Security Awareness Training (SAT).
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
3/11/2021 RENEWAL, CAP approved 3/16/2021
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The facility was offered technical assistance during the exit meeting regarding the
special investigation citation listed above. The facility was advised it was highly
concerning that a special investigation was completed and approved despite the
investigation not containing any information in the interviews with the foster parents
and foster youth regarding the allegations. In addition, there were no collateral
contacts made. The facility was advised to ensure that an investigation is thorough
and report must contain detailed information regarding the allegations.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care, substantiated
child abuse and/or neglect or substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans not related
to maltreatment during this licensing period.
During this period under review the agency expressed the impact that the COVID-19
pandemic had on overall compliance. In addition, the agency noted that staff
turnover and retention impacted overall compliance. One citation was noted as
repeat violations in the current inspection
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment reported the agency’s struggle related to staff
turnover. In addition to turn over the agency struggled with hiring new staff to replace
5

those who left. The Chief Administrator (CA) reported since the agency is small the
impact of turnover and hiring new staff makes it more difficult to meet requirements.
The CA indicated the staff will continue to review benchmarks, ensure timeliness of
reports, and ensure files are complete. Additionally, the supervisor will continue to
utilize tools such as MMR and Data Warehouse to ensure compliance and
timeliness.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with staff via telephone. Staff acknowledged the agency
has gone through transition due to recent management changes but felt as though
the agency handled the transition well. Staff reported feeling supported by
supervision and coworkers.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon
receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
